preqs: ENG1060, ENG1091 or MTH1030 or MTH1035 or ENG1005

rules.ruleString: For COURSE_CODE IN {3278, 4642} Do (Any co-req (I/W) unit in {MTH2010, MTH2015} and Any co-req (I/W) unit in {MTH2032}) Otherwise Any co-req (I/W) unit in {ENG2092}

(Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ENG1060, ENG1091} or  Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ENG1005, ENG1060} or  Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ENG1060, MTH1030} or  Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ENG1060, MTH1035})
(Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ENG1060, ENG1091} OR  Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ENG1060, MTH1030} OR  Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ENG1060, MTH1035})

description: This unit introduces numerical analysis techniques for interpolation, root finding, integration, the solution of ordinary differential equations, and the analysis of data.  The role computers play in the solution of modern aerospace engineering problems is emphasized through exposure to finite difference, finite volume and finite element techniques for partial differential equations, and the implementation of these techniques in commercial fluid dynamics and structural mechanics packages.
